SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

name.pehl.piriti.client.json
Annotation Type JsonField

@Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface JsonField

Annotation for mapping JSON data to POJO fields. The JSON data is selected by a "path" expression (the key of the JSON data) and converted if necessary to the type of the annotated field. For some types you can specify a format which is used when converting the JSON data to the fields type.

Please note that the annotated fields must not be private!

The following types are supported:

Type Default path expression Format options
boolean, Boolean <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
byte, Byte <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
char, Character <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
java.util.Date <fieldname> If no format is specified a default format is used. Otherwise must be a valid date format as described by DateTimeFormat
double, Double <fieldname> If no format is specified the JSON data is expected to be a JSONNumber, otherwise the JSON data is expected to be a JSONString and the format must be a valid number format as described by NumberFormat
float, Float <fieldname> If no format is specified the JSON data is expected to be a JSONNumber, otherwise the JSON data is expected to be a JSONString and the format must be a valid number format as described by NumberFormat
int, Integer <fieldname> If no format is specified the JSON data is expected to be a JSONNumber, otherwise the JSON data is expected to be a JSONString and the format must be a valid number format as described by NumberFormat
long, Long <fieldname> If no format is specified the JSON data is expected to be a JSONNumber, otherwise the JSON data is expected to be a JSONString and the format must be a valid number format as described by NumberFormat
short, Short <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
String <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
Enums <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
All types for which a JsonReader is registered <fieldname> No format supported. If specified it is ignored.
Arrays of the above types <fieldname> If a format is specified it is applied for all array elements.
Typed collections of the above types <fieldname> If a format is specified it is applied for all collection elements.

Supported collections:

  • Collection
  • List
  • ArrayList
  • LinkedList
  • Set
  • HashSet
  • SortedSet
  • TreeSet

Please note that all collections must have type parameters, otherwise they cannot be mapped.

Version:
$LastChangedRevision: 82 $
Author:
$LastChangedBy: harald.pehl $

Optional Element Summary
 String format
          The format to use when converting the JSON data to the fields type.
 String value
          A "path" expression (the key of the JSON data) to select the JSON data.
 

value

public abstract String value
A "path" expression (the key of the JSON data) to select the JSON data. Defaults to "" which means that the fields name is taken as a default.

Returns:
Default:
""

format

public abstract String format
The format to use when converting the JSON data to the fields type. Defaults to "".

Returns:
Default:
""
